body_text.text: The provinces of Pavia, Lodi, Cremona, and Mantova are 2.969 km 2 , 783 km 2 , 1.770 km 2 , 2.341 km 2 in area respectively, for a total area of 7.863 km 2 . Each province has several rural regions and a few REDCap (Research Electronic Data Capture) is a secure, web-based software platform designed to support data capture for research studies, providing 1) an intuitive interface for validated data capture; 2) audit trails for tracking data manipulation and export procedures; 3) automated export procedures for seamless data downloads to common statistical packages; and 4) procedures for data integration and interoperability with external sources.
body_text.section: Setting and Emergency Medical System (EMS) Description

body_text.text: The categorical variables are presented as number and percentage, and the continuous variables are presented as median and interquartile range (IQR). Differences and 95% CI were computed with quantile and binomial regression for continuous and categorical variables respectively. We computed the Spearman R and its 95% confidence interval (95% CI) to measure the strength of the correlation between the cumulative incidence of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest and the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 for the entire study sample and for each province. Statistical analyses were performed with the MedCalc version 19.2 (MedCalc Software Ltd) and the Stata software (version 16, StataCorp, College Station, TX, USA). Abbreviations:

FIGREF1.text: urban areas for a total population of 1,545,849 inhabitants (Pavia 545,810; Lodi 229,765; Cremona 358,512; Mantova 411,762) as of January 1st, 2019 and 1,547,333 (Pavia 545,888; Lodi 230,198; Cremona 358,955; Mantova 412,292) as of January 1st, 2020. The EMS dispatch center is unique to the four provinces and is connected to the European universal number for emergencies (112). It coordinates 45 ambulances staffed with basic life support -defibrillation (BLS-D)-trained personnel, and 21 advanced life support (ALS)-trained staffed vehicles (a physician and a specialized nurse or a specialized nurse only) uniformly distributed over the territory. There are also five helicopters with a physician and a specialized nurse on board which serve the entire region of Lombardy and other three in other neighboring regions. In case of suspected out-of-hospital cardiac arrest, the EMS dispatcher activates one to three emergency vehicles (which may include a helicopter), of which at least one has a physician on board, and assists the calling bystander during chest compressions (telephone CPR). There are no specific guidelines regarding how long continue resuscitation before terminating it; this decision is based on the clinical judgment of the physician. If the first vehicle arriving at the scene is staffed with BLS-D-trained personnel, the responders are instructed to initiated resuscitation (including CPR and use of an automated external defibrillator [AED]) unless clear signs of death are present (rigor mortis, hypostasis, injuries not compatible with life). To respond to the COVID-19 outbreak the numbers of BLS-D-trained staffed vehicles and ALS-trained staffed vehicles were increased to 63 and 27 respectively. Moreover, dispatchers were instructed to investigate, when receiving the call, whether the patient had had any possible symptoms related to COVID-19. For a patient suspected of having COVID-19 or diagnosed for COVID-19, EMS personnel were instructed to protect themselves by wearing personal protective equipment (face shield, N95 face mask, isolation gown) before initiating attempted resuscitation. No specific changes in BLS or ALS protocols were adopted during the COVID-19 epidemic. Lombardia Cardiac Arrest Registry (Lombardia CARe) Description The Lombardia Cardiac Arrest Registry (Lombardia CARe -NCT03197142) is a multicenter longitudinal prospective registry resulting from collaboration between the Fondazione IRCCS Policlinico San Matteo and the Azienda Regionale Emergenza Urgenza (AREU) representing the local emergency medical services (EMS). The registry was initiated in October 2014, at which time it covered only the province of Pavia and was designated the Pavia Cardiac Arrest Registry (Pavia CARe). We then extended enrollment to the provinces of Lodi, Cremona, and Mantova in January 1 st , 2019, and changed the name to LombardiaCARe. We added the province of Varese in January 1 st , 2020, and our ultimate goal is to cover the entire Lombardia Region with its 10,000,000 inhabitants in the coming years. The present study includes data from the provinces of Pavia, Lodi, Cremona, and Mantova, in the southern part of region of Lombardy in northern Italy, for which data have been available since January 2019. The registry was approved by the ethical committee of the Fondazione IRCCS Policlinico San Matteo (P-20140028219) and by each ethical committee in the individual provinces involved. All data are collected following Utstein 2014 recommendations 1 and managed using REDCap electronic data capture tools hosted by the Fondazione IRCCS Policlinico San Matteo 2,3 .
